Map.title: Map
Map.description: Core map properties (extent sets, levels of detail)

spatialReference.description: The projection for the given extents
spatialReference.title: Spatial reference

default.description: The default extent is the extent the map uses when first loaded.
default.title: Default Extent

full.description: The full extent is the extent to be used when the user clicks on the Home button. The default extent will be used if no full extent is supplied.
full.title: Full Extent

maximum.description: The maximum extent can be set to limit how far out and away the user is allowed to zoom and pan. The default or full extent will be used if no maximum extent is supplied.
maximum.title: Maximum Extent

extentSets.description: The default, full and maximum extents of the map
extentSets.title: Spatial Extents sets

lods.description: Level of detail for a specific tile schema
lods.title: Level of Detail set

lodSets.description: The levels of detail (zoom scales) available for the map
lodSets.title: Level of detail sets

id.description: A unique id identifying a tile schema (combination of an extent set and a zoom scale)
id.title: ID

name.description: The name to display in the basemap selector for the set of basemaps referencing this schema
name.title: Name

extentSetId.description: The extent set to be used for this basemap (should reference map.extentSets.id)
extentSetId.title: Extent set ID

lodSetId.description: Optional.  The Level of detail set to be used for this basemap (should reference map.lod.id)
lodSetId.title: LODs ID

overviewUrl.title: Static Overview Map
overviewUrl.Description: If not set, overview map will be tha same as the selected basemap

url.description: The service endpoint of the layer. It should match the type provided in layerType.
url.title: URL

tileSchemas.description: A unique combination of an LoD and an extent set (each basemap must fit into a tile schema)
tileSchemas.title: Tile Schemas

spatialReference.title: Spatial reference
spatialReference.description: The projection for the given extents

expandFactor.description: The ratio between the size of the overview map and the extent rectangle displayed on the overview map. The default value is 2, meaning the overview map will be at least twice the size of the extent rectangle.
expandFactor.title: Expand Factor

initialBasemapId.description: Initial basemap to load. If not supplied viewer will select any basemap.
initialBasemapId.title: Initial Basemap ID

id.description: A unique identifier for the basemap
id.title: Basemap ID

name.description: Name of the basemap used for labeling
name.title: Name

description.description: Description of the basemap. Will be visible when basemap selector is expanded.
description.title: Description

typeSummary.description: Optional base map type. This is descriptive only, and will be shown in the basemap selector.
typeSummary.title: Type Summary

altText.description: Alt text for the basemap thumbnail image.
altText.title: Alternate Text

thumbnailUrl.description: Path to image file to display in the basemap selector.
thumbnailUrl.title: Thumbnail URL

tileSchemaId.description: The tile schema for this basemap (should reference map.tileSchemas.id)
tileSchemaId.title: Tile Schema ID

layers.title: Layers
layers.description: A set of URLs which should be composited to form a basemap entry

value.description: Optional. Contains the attribution value. If empty, it will use copyright text from the server.
value.title: Description

link.description: URL to go to when clicked.
link.title: URL

baseMaps.description: A list of basemaps to be made available via the basemap selector.
baseMaps.title: Basemaps Collection

layers.description: A list of layers to be added to the viewer.
layers.title: Layers Collection

id.description: The id of the layer for referencing within the viewer (does not relate directly to any external service)
id.title: ID

name.description: The display name of the layer. If it is not present the viewer will make an attempt to scrape this information.
name.title: Name

url.description: The service endpoint of the layer. It should match the type provided in layerType.
url.title: URL

metadataUrl.description: The metadata url of the layer service
metadataUrl.title: Metadata URL

catalogueUrl.description: The catalogue url of the layer service
catalogueUrl.title: Catalogue URL

toggleSymbology.description: Allows individual symbols to have visibility toggled on/off.
toggleSymbology.title: Toggle symbology

tolerance.description: Specifies the tolerance in pixels when determining if a feature was clicked. Should be non-negative integer
tolerance.title: Tolerance

singleEntryCollapse.description: Indicates that the dynamic layer with a single layer entry should be rendered without the root group.
singleEntryCollapse.title: Single entry collapse

featureInfoMimeType.description: If specified indicates that GetFeatureInfo should be enabled for this WMS and indicates the format that should be requested.
featureInfoMimeType.title: Feature info MIME type

legendMimeType.description: If specified indicates that GetLegendGraphic should be enabled for this WMS and indicates the format that should be requested.  FIXME check legendUrl for additional requirements
legendMimeType.title: Legend MIME type

controls.title: Controls
controls.description: A list of all controls to be enabled on the specified layer

disabledControls.description: A list of controls which are visible, but disabled for user modification
disabledControls.title: Disabled controls

snapshot.description: Retrieve all feature data immediately on load
snapshot.title: Snapshot

title.description: Specifies the table title to apply.
title.title: Title

description.description: Specifies the additional information to display in the setting panel to give more information about a table.
description.title: Description

maximize.description: Specifies the default table size when first open. True: maximize view; False: split view.
maximize.title: Maximize

value.description: Specifies the default filter to apply to a table (for global search).
value.title: Value

applyMap.description: Specifies if the default filters (from fields filter) are apply to the map (definition query). True: it is applied; False: it is not applied.
applyMap.title: Apply map

columns.title: Fields

data.description: Specifies the field name (data) to use to link to the layer column. Must exist in the layer.
data.title: Data

title.description: Specifies the column title, uses the layer column name or alias if missing.
title.title: Title

description.description: Specifies the additional information to display in the setting panel to give more information about a column. Do not add description if missing.
description.title: Description

visible.description: Specifies if column is visible by default. True: column is visible; False: column is hidden.
visible.title: Visible

width.description: Specifies the column width. If missing, calculated column width will be use.
width.title: Width

sort.description: Specifies if column is sort. If missing, no sort is applied.
sort.title: Sort

searchable.description: Specifies if column can be filter. True: column can be filter; False: no filter can be applied from global search or filter. If this is false, do not set a filter because it will not be use.
searchable.title: Searchable

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Specifies the filter information for a column.

type.description: Specifies the filter type to use. If type is not specified, data field type will be use. String filter can be string or selector. Other filter must be the same type. If not, apply on map will fails.
type.title: Type

value.description: Specifies the filter value. For date and number values are split by ',' (e.g. 0,100). For selector it needs an array like ["Fire", "Fatality"]
value.title: Value

static.description: Specifies if filter is modifiable. True: filter value can't be modified; False: filter value can be modified.
static.title: Static

columns.description: Specifies the array of fields for the table. When there is an item in this array, it will be use to define wich and how column will be set for the table. If a column is not in the array it will be assume as disabled.

table.description: Specifies how layers fields and global search are set

index.title: Index
index.description: The index of the layer in the map service.

name.title: Name
name.description: A descriptive name for the layer, can override the name coming from the service.

outfields.title: Out fields
outfields.description: A comma separated list of attribute names that should be requested on query.

stateOnly.title: State only
stateOnly.description: A flag indicating this entry is only for state tracking (i.e. it should not be displayed on the UI and all of the controls will be ignored, but the layer itself will be displayed on the map with the given state settings).

id.title: ID
id.description: The id of the layer entry in the WMS

allStyles.title: All styles
allStyles.description: All the styles for the layer entry in the WMS

currentStyle.title: Current style
currentStyle.description: The current style for the layer entry in the WMS

Ui.title: Ui
Ui.description: A set of service endpoints used by the viewer

fullscreen.description: Indicates viewer takes up entire viewport
fullscreen.title: Fullscreen

logoUrl.description: An optional image to be used in the place of the default viewer logo
logoUrl.title: Logo URL

failureMessage.title: Failure Message
failureMessage.description: An optional message to be used in place of the failure message

failureImageUrl.title: Failure Image Url
failureImageUrl.description: An optional image to be used in place of the failure Image

title.description: An optional title to be used in the place of the default viewer title
title.title: Title

appBar.description: Provides configuration to the main app toolbar. If not supplied, the all default appbar controls are displayed. To completely hide the toolbar, provide the following: { sideMenu: false, geoSearch: false, layers: false }.

sideMenu.description: Shows the side menu button in the main app toolbar.
sideMenu.title: Side Menu

geoSearch.description: Shows the geosearch button in the main app toolbar. The button will be hidden if geosearch component is disabled or no search service URLs are provided.
geoSearch.title: Geo Search

basemap.description: Shows the basemap selector button in the main app toolbar.
basemap.title: Basemap Selector

layers.description: Shows the layers button in the main app toolbar.
layers.title: Layers Selector

appBar.title: Application Bar

logo.description: Indicates if the logo should be shown in the left side menu.
logo.title: Show Logo

sideMenu.description: Specifies which options are available in the left side menu.
sideMenu.title: Side Menu

restrictNavigation.description: Will restrict the user from panning beyond the maximum extent.
restrictNavigation.title: Restrict Navigation

folderName.description: Help folder name who contain the help description and images
folderName.title: Folder Name

reorderable.description: Specifies if the items in the legend can be reordered; structured legend ignores this property.
reorderable.title: Is Reorderable

allowImport.description: Specifies if the user-added layers are allowed.
allowImport.title: Allow Layers Import

isOpen.description: Specifies whether the legend is opened by default on initial loading of the map for small, medium, and large viewports

large.description: Whether the legend is opened by default on initial loading of the map for large viewports
large.title: Open by default in large display

medium.description: Whether the legend is opened by default on initial loading of the map for medium viewports
medium.title: Open by default in medium display

small.description: Whether the legend is opened by default on initial loading of the map for small viewports
small.title: Open by default in small display

isOpen.title: Legend openning options

about.description: About properties from configuration file or Markdown folder
about.title: About Map

folderName.description: About properties from configuration file or Markdown folder
folderName.title: Folder Name

tableIsOpen.description: Specifies whether the table panel is opened by default on initial loading of the map for small, medium, and large viewports

id.description: The id of the layer for referencing within the viewer. Only works with feature layer.
id.title: Layer ID

large.description: Whether the table panel is opened by default on initial loading of the map for large viewports
large.title: Open by default in large display

medium.description: Whether the table panel is opened by default on initial loading of the map for medium viewports
medium.title: Open by default in medium display

small.description: Whether the table panel is opened by default on initial loading of the map for small viewports
small.title: Open by default in small display

tableIsOpen.title: Table openning options

Services.description: A set of service endpoints used by the viewer
Services.title: Services

proxyUrl.description: An optional proxy to be used for dealing with same-origin issues.  URL must either be a relative path on the same server or an absolute path on a server which sets CORS headers.
proxyUrl.title: Proxy URL

exportMapUrl.description: An ESRI service endpoint for generating map images.  Should point directly to an endpoint that can be consumed by ESRI PrintTask.
exportMapUrl.title: Export Map URL

geometryUrl.description: A URL to an ESRI ArcGIS geometry service REST endpoint.
geometryUrl.title: Geometry URL

googleAPIKey.description: Google API key to enable geo location and share link shortening.
googleAPIKey.title: Google API URL

search.description: Search properties including ability to disable certain types of searches (NTS, Postal Code/FSA, and/or LAT/LNG) and to set service endpoint urls

disabledSearches.description: Disable specific types of searches including NTS, Postal Code/FSA, or LAT/LNG
disabledSearches.title: Search type to disable

search.title: Geo Search

value.description: Value to be passed to the generation function of this export component.

showInfoSymbology.description: Indicates whether symbology from info sections should be included in export legend

showControlledSymbology.description: Indicates whether symbology from controlled layers should be included in export legend

footnote.description: Foot notice to add to exported map
footnote.title: Footnote

version.title: Version
version.description: The schema version used to validate the configuration file.The schema should enumerate the list of versions accepted by this version of the viewer.

language.title: Language
language.description: ISO 639-1 code indicating the language of strings in the schema file

type.title: Slider Type
type.description: If the Date or WMS-T is selected, range and limit must be in milliseconds. Note: Date is for esri layer and WMS-T is for ogc WMS-T layer.

rangeType.title: Range Type
rangeType.description: Type of range (single for one handle or dual for 2 handles).

stepType.title: Step Type
stepType.description: Type of step (dynamic for open values or static from a list of values).

precision.title: Precision
precision.description: Precision of numeric data (0, 1, 2) or date (Date, Hour).

rangeInterval.title: Interval (in milliseconds for date data type)
rangeInterval.description: When the limit type is dynamic, this option allows you to define a preset interval between the two handles. The value must be in milliseconds date data type. For other numerical value formats, enter the desired value directly. To convert a time interval into milliseconds, use the built-in converter. Will start at the beginning of the scroll bar, unless the "Start at end" option is enabled.

min.title: Minimum value of the range (in milliseconds for date data type)
min.description: The minimum value of the range that corresponds to the position of the left handle. If not defined, the minimum limit will be used. The value must be in milliseconds date data type. For other numerical value formats, enter the desired value directly. To convert a date to milliseconds, use the site's built-in converter.

max.title: Maximum value of the range (in milliseconds for date data type)
max.description: The maximum value of the range that corresponds to the position of the right handle. If not defined, the maximum limit will be used. The value must be in milliseconds date data type. For other numerical value formats, enter the desired value directly. To convert a date to milliseconds, use the site's built-in converter.

limit.title: Limits of the data set values

min.title: Minimum Limit
min.description: The minimum value contained in the dataset. If not defined, the value will be found using the values present in the used field of the layer. To convert a date to milliseconds, use the site's built-in converter.

max.title: Maximum Limit
max.description: The maximum value contained in the dataset. If not defined, the value will be found using the values present in the used field of the layer. To convert a date to milliseconds, use the site's built-in converter.

staticItems.title: Static Limit Values
staticItems.description: The values for static limit. Note: the minimum and maximum limits are used to define the lower and upper static limits. Enter only the intermediate values here.

units.title: Units
units.description: Shown at the right of the time axis. Keep it short to improve readability.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description to add in the section below the slider.

id.description: The id of the layer for referencing within the viewer (does not relate directly to any external service).
id.title: Layer id

isTimeAware.title: Is Time Aware
isTimeAware.description: If time aware is true, the slider will use the TimeInfo (ESRI) or time dimension (WMS) to extract limits and range.

type.title: Type
type.description: Retreive the labels from a field or from the configuration.

values.title: Values
values.description: Values separated by semi colon or field name.

split.title: Split Character
split.description: Character to use to split list of values.

colors.title: Datasets Colors
colors.description: Hexadecimal color code separated by semicolon. If not provided, default colors will be use.

cutOut.title: Cut Out Percentage
cutOut.description: Cut out percentage to use to give doughnut effect.

type.title: Type
type.description: Retreive the labels from a field or configuration for bar chart or from values (linear or time) for line chart.

values.title: Values
values.description: Values separated by semicolon or field name.

split.title: Split Character
split.description: Character to use to split list of values.

type.title: Type
type.description: Retreive the labels from a field or configuration for bar chart or from values (linear or time) for line chart.

values.title: Values
values.description: Values separated by semicolon or field name.

split.title: Split Character
split.description: Character to use to split list of values.

nameField.title: Name Field
nameField.description: Field name to use for the chart selection combo box when multiple charts.

type.title: Chart Data Type
type.description: Type of data (inline for items inside the layer or link for items inside a link table).

linkField.title: Link Field
linkField.description: Field name for the link between the layer and the table.

type.title: Type of data inside the field
type.description: Single if there is only one value inside the field. Combine if we use time axis and time and value are part of the field.

linkType.title: Type of link
linkType.description: How data is structure inside the link table (single for one field for value and one for date OR multiple if there is multiple datasets inside one field and the chart needs to parse).

link.title: Link Field
link.description: Link field to link between layer and table.

date.title: Date Field
date.description: Field to use for the date

values.title: Label Values
values.description: Field name to get labels from for link type multi.

type.title: Type
type.description: Retreive the labels from a field or from the configuration.

values.title: Values
values.description: Values separated by semicolon or field name.

split.title: Split Character
split.description: Character to use to split list of values.

regex.title: Dataset splitter
regex.description:
Regex value to split datasets inside the field.

This field is to manage when you have multiple datasets or combine values in the same field. To be able to separate datasets from values, we will use a regex expression. We encourage you to use your data and test your regex expression on a online site like https://regex101.com.

Below we list some samples of datasets and regex:

  • Sample 1
    • Data: [255;255;255];[120;232;23];[32;44;134]
    • Regex: \\[|\\];\\[|\\]
    • Ouput: 3 datasets (e.g. 255;255;255). Values inside dataset will be split by the field 'Values Splitter'.
  • Sample 2
    • Data: (2011-03-28,0.511),(2011-04-04,0.421)
    • Regex: \\(|\\),\\(|\\)
    • Ouput: 1 datasets, 2 pairs of values (e.g. 2011-03-28,0.511). Values inside are combined (y and x axis) and will be split by the field 'Values Splitter'.

Note: we need to double the '\' character

split.title: Values splitter
split.description: Character to use to split values inside a field. E.g. a field contains '10;20;30' means there is 3 values split by ';' or [1,2,3];[4,5,6] means there is 2 datasets with 3 values each split by ','.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: Prefix to add to data hover.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: Suffix to add to data hover.

value.title: Value
value.description: String with the custom details in markdown notation.

id.description: The id of the layer for referencing within the viewer (does not relate directly to any external service).
id.title: Layer id

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: Tools to add to draw toolbar.

legendStack.title: Stack legend items (useful with the stack option to see all active elements legend)

id.description: The id of the layer for referencing within the viewer (does not relate directly to any external service).
id.title: Layer id

legend.title: Legend
legend.description: Add items for a custom legend, leave it blank for default legend.
